sen.j: 石器（せっき）とは、石を材料として、それを加工して製作した道具の総称である。
sen.e: "Sekki" is a general term for tools manufactured through processing stone materials.
Sekki refers to a general term for tools manufactured through processing stone materials.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。
sen.e: Sekki refers to a general term for tools manufactured through processing stone materials.

sen.j: 主として手の延長としての石製の道具を指し、石碑や墓石のようなものは含めない。
sen.e: It means mainly tools made of stone as an extension of human hands, but does not include such items as sekihi (stone monuments) and hakaishi (gravestones).
It means mainly tools made of stone as an extension of human hands, but does not include such items as stone monuments and gravestones.
sen.cmt: 石碑、墓石 は英語のみの表現としました。
sen.e: It means mainly tools made of stone as an extension of human hands, but does not include such items as stone monuments and gravestones.

sen.j: 縄文時代に儀式に使用されたと考えられる石棒を広義の石器に含めることがある。
sen.e: Seki-bo (stone bars) which are believed to have been used for rituals in the Jomon Period may be included in Sekki (stone tools) in the broad sense.
Sekibo (stone bars) which are believed to have been used for rituals in the Jomon period may be included in sekki in the broad sense.
sen.cmt: 石器 既出のため、補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Sekibo (stone bars) which are believed to have been used for rituals in the Jomon period may be included in sekki in the broad sense.

sen.j: 石器は、加工方法によって大きく2種類に区分される。
sen.e: Sekki (stone tools) may be classified into two main groups depending on the processing methods.
Sekki may be classified into two main groups depending on the processing methods.
sen.cmt: 石器 既出のため、補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Sekki may be classified into two main groups depending on the processing methods.

sen.j: 一つは、石同士あるいは、道具を使用して打ち叩くことによって、剥片をはいで道具として使用するのにかなった形に成形する打製石器（だせいせっき）である。
sen.e: One is a group of Dasei-sekki (chipped stone tools) which were formed into a shape usable as a tool by chipping away flakes from a stone by beating it with another stone or a tool.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One is a group of Dasei-sekki (chipped stone tools) which were formed into a shape usable as a tool by chipping away flakes from a stone by beating it with another stone or a tool.
One is a group of Dasei-sekki (chipped stone tools) which were formed into a shape usable as a tool by chipping away flakes from a stone by beating it with another stone or a tool.

sen.j: もう一つは、刃を鋭くするため、また儀式に使用するために磨き上げた磨製石器（ませいせっき）とがある。
sen.e: Another group is consisted of Masei-sekki (ground stoneware) which were made up through a grinding process in order to sharpen edges or to be used for ritual purposes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Another group is consisted of Masei-sekki (ground stoneware) which were made up through a grinding process in order to sharpen edges or to be used for ritual purposes.
Another group is consisted of Masei-sekki (ground stoneware) which were made up through a grinding process in order to sharpen edges or to be used for ritual purposes.

sen.j: 打製石器は人類の最も古い道具の一つと考えられ、アウストラロピテクスが使っていたとする説もある。
sen.e: Dasei-sekki (chipped stone tools) is considered to be the earliest tools used by human beings like Australopithecus according to one theory.
Dasei-sekki is considered to be the earliest tools used by human beings like Australopithecus according to one theory.
sen.cmt: 打製石器 既出のため、補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Dasei-sekki is considered to be the earliest tools used by human beings like Australopithecus according to one theory.

sen.j: 他の動物でも石を道具として使用する例はあるが、加工するのは人間だけである。
sen.e: Although there are some examples of other animals that use stones as a tool, it is only the human beings who can fabricate a tool by processing it.
Although there are some examples of other animals that use stones as a tool, it is only the human beings who can fabricate tools by processing stones.
Although there are some examples of other animals that use stones as a tool, it is only the human beings who can fabricate tools by processing stones.

sen.j: ただし、チンパンジーでそれに近い例があるともいう。
sen.e: However, some chimpanzees are reportedly able to do similarly to the human beings.
However, some chimpanzees are reportedly able to do similar things as human beings.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: However, some chimpanzees are reportedly able to do similar things as human beings.

sen.j: オルドワン型石器群は、ヒト科人類による最古の石器群といわれている。
sen.e: Oldowan stone tool industry is said to be the earliest stone tool industry used by Hominins (or Hominini).
Oldowan stone tool industry is said to be the earliest stone tool industry used by Hominins (or Hominini).
Oldowan stone tool industry is said to be the earliest stone tool industry used by Hominins (or Hominini).

sen.j: 礫の一部を打撃して造るチョッパー・チョッピングツールを主体とする。
sen.e: Its main items were Choppers and Chopping tools which were produced by beating a part of a pebble.
Its main items were Choppers and Chopping tools which were produced by beating a part of a pebble.
Its main items were Choppers and Chopping tools which were produced by beating a part of a pebble.

sen.j: この石器群は、ケニアのトゥルカナ湖東海岸の諸遺跡やタンザニアのオルドヴァイ峡谷の遺跡などで出土している。
sen.e: The Oldowan stone tool industries were unearthed at various remains on the east coast of the Lake Turkana in Kenya as well as other remains in the Olduvai Gorge in Tanzania.
The Oldowan stone tool industries were unearthed at various remains on the east coast of the Lake Turkana in Kenya as well as other remains in the Olduvai Gorge in Tanzania.
The Oldowan stone tool industries were unearthed at various remains on the east coast of the Lake Turkana in Kenya as well as other remains in the Olduvai Gorge in Tanzania.

sen.j: 因みに、この石器の担い手はホモ・ハビリスもしくは頑丈型猿人と推測されている。
sen.e: By the way, these stone tools are presumed to have been sustained by Homo Habilis of Genus Homo or Genus Paranthropus.
By the way, these stone tools are presumed to have been sustained by Homo Habilis of Genus Homo or Genus Paranthropus.
By the way, these stone tools are presumed to have been sustained by Homo Habilis of Genus Homo or Genus Paranthropus.

sen.j: 磨製石器はジョン・ラボックによって新石器時代の指標とされたが、実際には中石器時代に当たる紀元前9000年に北西ヨーロッパや西アジアで局部磨製石器が出現している。
sen.e: Although Masei-sekki (ground stoneware) were regarded as an indicator of the Neolithic Period by John Lubbock, some partly-ground stoneware were found to have been actually used in Northwest Europe and West Asia in around 9000 B.C. corresponding to Metholithic era.

Although Masei-sekki was regarded as an indicator of the Neolithic era by John Lubbock, partly-ground stoneware was found to have been actually used in Northwest Europe and West Asia in around 9000 B.C. corresponding to Mesolithic era.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の補足を削除しました。Period →era に統一しました。スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Although Masei-sekki was regarded as an indicator of the Neolithic era by John Lubbock, partly-ground stoneware was found to have been actually used in Northwest Europe and West Asia in around 9000 B.C. corresponding to Mesolithic era.

sen.j: 石器の種類
sen.e: Kinds of Sekki (stone tools):
Kinds of sekki

sen.e: Kinds of sekki

sen.j: 石核 (Core)石器を制作した時に残った石材。
sen.e: Sekkaku (Cores)・・・Stone materials remained after manufacturing Sekki (a stone tool):
Sekkaku (cores): Stone materials remained after manufacturing sekki
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。既出単語の補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Sekkaku (cores): Stone materials remained after manufacturing sekki

sen.j: 剥片 (Flake)石器を制作した時に発生した欠片。
sen.e: Hakuhen (Flakes)・・・Fragments separated when manufacturing Sekki (a stone tool):
Hakuhen (flakes): Fragments separated when manufacturing sekki
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。既出単語の補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Hakuhen (flakes): Fragments separated when manufacturing sekki

sen.j: 石刃、ブレード (Blade)後期旧石器時代に特徴的な石器の素材。
sen.e: Sekijin (stone blades), Buredo (Blade)・・・Characteristic materials for stone tools in the late Paleolithic Period:
Sekijin (stone blades), Blades: Characteristic materials for stone tools in the late Paleolithic Period
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Sekijin (stone blades), Blades: Characteristic materials for stone tools in the late Paleolithic Period

sen.j: 石核から大量の石刃を創り出し、これを加工して石器にする。
sen.e: A lot of Sekijin (stone blade) were produced out of Sekkaku (Core) and were processed into Sekki (stone tools).
A lot of sekijin were produced out of sekkaku and were processed into sekki.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の補足を削除しました。
sen.e: A lot of sekijin were produced out of sekkaku and were processed into sekki.

sen.j: 礫器 (Pebble Tool) もっとも原始的な石器の一つである。
sen.e: Rekki (Pebble Tool)・・・a kind of most primitive stone tools.
Rekki (pebble tool): One of the most primitive stone tools
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Rekki (pebble tool): One of the most primitive stone tools

sen.j: チョッパー (Chopper) - 礫の一部に片面から数回の打撃によって打ち欠いて刃をつけた石器。
sen.e: Choppers・・・a kind of pebble tool having an edge formed by beating one side of a pebble for several times:
Choppers: A kind of pebble tool having an edge formed by beating one side of a pebble for several times
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Choppers: A kind of pebble tool having an edge formed by beating one side of a pebble for several times

sen.j: 片刃の礫器とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Kataha no Rekki (Pebble Tool with a single edge).
It is also called Kataha no Rekki (Pebble Tool with a single edge).
It is also called Kataha no Rekki (Pebble Tool with a single edge).

sen.j: 刃の断面の角度は20°～30°くらいが多い。
sen.e: The angle of cross section of the Chopper was measured mostly between 20 to 30 degrees.
The angle of cross section of the chopper was measured mostly between 20 to 30 degrees.
sen.cmt: chopper 小文字にしました。
sen.e: The angle of cross section of the chopper was measured mostly between 20 to 30 degrees.

sen.j: チョッピング＝トゥール (Chopping Tool) - 礫の一部に両面から交互に打撃を加えて、表面を剥離させジグザグ状の刃をつけた石器。
sen.e: Chopping Tool・・・a kind of Pebble Tool having a zig-zag edge formed by exfoliating a part of a pebble by beating it from both sides:
Chopping tool: A kind of pebble tool having a zig-zag edge formed by exfoliating a part of a pebble by beating it from both sides
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Chopping tool: A kind of pebble tool having a zig-zag edge formed by exfoliating a part of a pebble by beating it from both sides

sen.j: 握斧、握槌、ハンド＝アックス (Hand Axe)礫の全体を両面から打ち欠いて刃をつけた石器。
sen.e: Akufu (ax with handgrip), Nigiri-tsuchi (hammer with handgrip), Hand Axe・・・a kind of stone tool having edges formed by beating a whole part of a pebble from both sides:
Akufu (ax with handgrip), Nigiri-tsuchi (hammer with handgrip), Hand Axe: A kind of stone tool having edges formed by beating a whole part of a pebble from both sides
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Akufu (ax with handgrip), Nigiri-tsuchi (hammer with handgrip), Hand Axe: A kind of stone tool having edges formed by beating a whole part of a pebble from both sides

sen.j: 上端が尖る形状が多く、舌状、フィクロン形、槍先形あるいはミコク形、卵形、心臓形、アーモンド形などど呼称される場合がある。
sen.e: Many of their upper ends were pointed in such shapes as of so called tongue, fikuron, spearhead or mikoku, egg, heart, almond and so on.
sen.cmt: 「フィクロン形」「ミコク形」のスペル・意味不明。
sen.e: Many of their upper ends were pointed in such shapes as of so called tongue, ficron, spearhead or Micoquien, egg, heart, almond and so on.
sen.cmt: フィクロン→ficron、 ミコク矢→Micoquien としました。（http://www.enotes.com/topic/Micoquienを参照）
sen.e: Many of their upper ends were pointed in such shapes as of so called tongue, ficron, spearhead or Micoquien, egg, heart, almond and so on.

sen.j: 尖頭器 (Point)先端を鋭く尖らせた石器。
sen.e: Sentoki (Points)・・・a kind of stone tools with a sharp point:
Sentoki (points): A kind of stone tools with a sharp point
sen.cmt: ・・・→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Sentoki (points): A kind of stone tools with a sharp point

sen.j: 槍先に付けたと考えられる。
sen.e: They were supposedly attached to spear heads.
They were supposedly attached to spear heads.
They were supposedly attached to spear heads.

sen.j: 細長く鋭く尖る形のものが典型的だが、それ以外にも多くの種類の尖頭器がある。
sen.e: Their typical shape was long, thin and sharply-pointed, but there were many other shapes, too.
Their typical shape was long, thin and sharply-pointed, but there were many other shapes, too.
Their typical shape was long, thin and sharply-pointed, but there were many other shapes, too.

sen.j: 石槍とも言う。
sen.e: They are also called ishi-yari (stone spears).
They are also called ishi-yari (stone spears).
They are also called ishi-yari (stone spears).

sen.j: 削器、スクレーパー (Scraper) F.ボルドによると剥片の先端部分を打ち欠いて刃をつけた石器。

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 日本列島の旧石器時代に用いられた石材の代表的なものは、黒曜石、頁岩、サヌカイトなどがあげられる。
sen.e: Typical stone materials used in Japan in the Paleolithic Period were Kokuyo-seki (obsidian), Ketsu-gan (shale), Sanukite (Sanuki-gan stone) and others.
Typical stone materials used in Japan in the Paleolithic Period were obsidian, shale, Sanukite (Sanuki-gan stone) and others.
sen.cmt: 黒曜石、頁岩は、英語の表現のみとしました。
sen.e: Typical stone materials used in Japan in the Paleolithic Period were obsidian, shale, Sanukite (Sanuki-gan stone) and others.

sen.j: 北海道地方 - 東部に遠軽町白滝黒曜石原産地、西部に赤石川黒曜石原産地がある。
sen.e: Hokkaido Region: Kokuyo-seki (obsidian) are produced in Shirataki, Engaru-cho Town, in the east part of Hokkaido and in Akaishikawa in the west part.
Hokkaido region: Obsidian is produced in Shirataki, Engaru-cho in the east of Hokkaido and in Akaishikawa in the west of Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 黒曜石、頁岩は、英語の表現のみとしました。
sen.e: Hokkaido region: Obsidian is produced in Shirataki, Engaru-cho in the east of Hokkaido and in Akaishikawa in the west of Hokkaido.

sen.j: 東北地方 - 広く硬質頁岩が分布。
sen.e: Tohoku Region: Production areas of hard shale are widely spread throughout the Tohoku Region.
Tohoku region: Production areas of hard shale are widely spread throughout the Tohoku region.
sen.cmt: region 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Tohoku region: Production areas of hard shale are widely spread throughout the Tohoku region.

sen.j: 関東地方 - 太平洋沖には神津島黒曜石原産地がある
sen.e: Kanto region: Obsidian is produced in Kozu-shima Island in the offshore of the Pacific Ocean.
Kanto region: Obsidian is produced in Kozu-shima Island in the offshore of the Pacific Ocean.

sen.j: 中部地方 - 中央高地には和田峠 (長野県)の黒曜石原産地がある。
sen.e: Chubu region: Obsidian is produced in the Wada-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture) in the central highlands region.
Chubu region: Obsidian is produced in the Wada-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture) in the central highlands region.

sen.j: 近畿・中四国地域 - サヌカイトは奈良県二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)および香川県五色台、さぬき市にある金山などで産出する。
sen.e: Kinki, Chugoku and Shikoku regions: Sanukite is produced in the Mt. Nijo in Nara Prefecture (Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture), Goshikidai mountain range in Kagawa Prefecture as well as Mt. Kana, Sanuki City in Kagawa Prefecture.

Kinki, Chugoku and Shikoku regions: Sanukite is produced in the Mt. Nijo in Nara Prefecture (Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture), Goshikidai mountain range in Kagawa Prefecture as well as Mt. Kana, Sanuki City in Kagawa Prefecture.
